Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • Edge

  • public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a representation of a 'Edge', which is part of the Graph ADT It is best used in combination with the 'Graph ADT' class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(int n)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean betweenNode(Node a, Node b)
      Returns true or false if a and b are connected by the same edge
      java.lang.String getDirection()
      Returns the direction which the self-arc edge is facing
      int getNode(int n)
      Gets the respective opposite node.
      int getNodeOne()
      Returns the index of the first connected node
      int getNodeTwo()
      Returns the index of the second connected node
      boolean getNull()
      Returns a true or false if edge is currently active or not
      int getNumber()
      Obtains the value of the number of this edge
      java.lang.String getType()
      Returns the edge type
      void setDirection(java.lang.String s)
      Sets the direction of the self-arc edge Only supports "up", "right", "left" and "down"
      void setNodes(Node a, Node b)
      Takes the nodes 'a' and 'b' and stores their index values.
      void setType(java.lang.String s)
      Sets the type of this edge Supports only "normal", "directed" or "selfarc" edges
      void toggleNull(java.lang.Boolean b)
      Sets the edge to be active or inactive

        public Edge(int n)
        Constructor. Each edge should have a unique index value.

        public void setDirection(java.lang.String s)

        the index of Node Two

      • setNodes

        public void setNodes(Node a,
                     Node b)
        Takes the nodes 'a' and 'b' and stores their index values. If this is a directed arc, place the first node in a and the second in b If this is a selfarc, ensure that both nodes are the same
        Parameters:
        a - the first node
        b - the second node

      • getNode

        public int getNode(int n)
        Gets the respective opposite node. E.g if asking for node one, get node two.
        Parameters:
        n - the initial node
        Returns:
        the opposite node

      • betweenNode

        public boolean betweenNode(Node a,
                           Node b)
        Returns true or false if a and b are connected by the same edge
        Parameters:
        a - the first node
        b - the second node
        Returns:
        true or false depending if Node a and Node b are connected

      • getNull

        public boolean getNull()
        Returns a true or false if edge is currently active or not
        Returns:
        true or false if edge is Null

      • toggleNull

        public void toggleNull(java.lang.Boolean b)
        Sets the edge to be active or inactive
        Parameters:
        b - true for inactive false for active
